column2: many of us think about corn grains as food for chickens
column5: but corn has many other uses. In the food industry
column8: is added into various foods such as pasta
column14: and baby food. Some edible oils and syrups are also made from corn
column15: such as fructose and other sweeteners
column16: used in most sodas or even juices sold in supermarkets. Processed corn is also used in medicines
column22: and solvents. Corn residues or "scraps" have recently been used to create biodegradable materials similar to plastics. Another use for corn is to use its sugars to make biodiesel fuel for use in cars and other vehicles.So
column23: not only can we eat corn as an additive mixed into different foods
column24: or as a side dish like delicious corn on the cob
column26: or as a snack in the form of nachos and popcorn: around the world
column27: there are many dishes—and cultures—that totally revolve around corn. In such cultures
column28: corn is a central component of their cuisines.
